Key Arguments: The bill's definition of misinformation is subjective and grants the government arbitrary power.
The bill gives ACMA draconian powers to silence government critics, creating a chilling effect on free expression.
The legislation protects government and mainstream media, creating an imbalance and undermining equality of speech.
Notable Quotes: We believe represents a direct attack on freedom of speech.
The bill's highly subjective definition of 'misinformation' grants the government arbitrary power.
This creates a chilling effect on free expression and inhibits open dialogue.
